title: The new Love Actually sequel trailer features Hugh Grant, Martine McCutcheon and Keira Knightley and it is perfection
text:
&&&&& To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video 
With just a matter of hours to go before we finally get to see the Love Actually remake, the first official trailer has finally dropped.
Russia hits back at Ukraine over Eurovision Song Contest ban And this time it features a whole bunch of the cast, including Keira Knightley, Liam Neeson Martine McCutcheon, Hugh Grant, Bill Nighy, Chiwetel Ejiofor and Rowan Atkinson.
In the trailer, the familiar faces hold up Andrew Lincoln-style cards as they urge fans to tune in to watch them on Red Nose Day, joking about which of them has aged the best and how they’ve all grown up.
We’d already been teased with Andrew Lincoln’s teaser, in which he used his famous cards to tell us all about the Red Nose Day special, just like the ones his character Mark used to tell Keira’s character Juliet he was in love with her.
Creator Richard Curtis has penned a 10-minute sequel to his 2003 hit romcom for Comic Relief, titled Red Nose Day, Actually.

Red Nose Day, Actually will air on March 24 on BBC One as part of Comic Relief’s broadcast from 7pm.
It has been confirmed that Emma Thompson, Martin Freeman, Laura Linney and Rodrigo Santoro will not be returning for the sequel.
